content:
TITLE: Running Docker Setup Script (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the Python script that builds and starts the Docker containers for Archon. This is the recommended installation method as it handles all setup automatically.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v5-parallel-specialized-agents/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python run_docker.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Docker Installation Commands - Bash
DESCRIPTION: Commands for cloning the repository and setting up Archon using Docker. This is the recommended installation method that automatically builds and runs both the MCP and main Archon containers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v4-streamlit-ui-overhaul/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/coleam00/archon.git
cd archon/iterations/v4-streamlit-ui-overhaul
python run_docker.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning and Setting Up Archon with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Commands for cloning the Archon repository and setting it up using Docker. This approach is recommended for most users as it handles all dependencies automatically.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v6-tool-library-integration/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/coleam00/archon.git
cd archon

# This will build both containers and start Archon
python run_docker.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Archon with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Docker setup script that builds and starts both Archon containers automatically.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# This will build both containers and start Archon
python run_docker.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning Archon Repository (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the Archon repository from GitHub and navigate to the project directory. This is the first step for both Docker and local Python installation methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v5-parallel-specialized-agents/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/coleam00/archon.git
cd archon
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning the Archon Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the Archon repository from GitHub and navigate to the project directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/coleam00/archon.git
cd archon
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning and Setting Up the Archon V2 Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the Archon repository and navigate to the v2-agentic-workflow directory. This is the first step in setting up the project locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v2-agentic-workflow/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/coleam00/archon.git
cd archon/iterations/v2-agentic-workflow
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning the Archon Repository in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Commands for cloning the Archon repository from GitHub and navigating to the V1 single agent directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v1-single-agent/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/coleam00/archon.git
cd archon/iterations/v1-single-agent
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning and Installing Archon V3 Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands for cloning the Archon V3 repository from GitHub and navigating to the appropriate directory for installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v3-mcp-support/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/coleam00/archon.git
cd archon/iterations/v3-mcp-support
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Local Python Environment (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a virtual environment, activate it, and install the required dependencies for running Archon locally without Docker. This is an alternative to the Docker installation method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v5-parallel-specialized-agents/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Local Python Installation Commands - Bash
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing Archon locally using Python virtual environment. This installation method is alternative to Docker and requires manual setup of dependencies and environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v4-streamlit-ui-overhaul/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/coleam00/archon.git
cd archon/iterations/v4-streamlit-ui-overhaul
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
streamlit run streamlit_ui.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Local Python Installation for Archon
DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up Archon using a local Python installation. This includes creating a virtual environment, installing dependencies, and starting the Streamlit UI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v6-tool-library-integration/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/coleam00/archon.git
cd archon

python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

streamlit run streamlit_ui.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Archon with Local Python Installation
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up a virtual environment, install dependencies, and start the Streamlit UI for Archon without Docker.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Python Virtual Environment for Archon
DESCRIPTION: Commands for creating a Python virtual environment, activating it, and installing project dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v1-single-agent/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Required Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a Python virtual environment and install all the required dependencies for the Archon V2 project using pip.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v2-agentic-workflow/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with Virtual Environment
DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up a Python virtual environment and installing the required dependencies from the requirements.txt file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v3-mcp-support/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running MCP Setup Script
DESCRIPTION: Command for running the MCP setup script which creates a virtual environment, installs dependencies, and generates an MCP configuration file for AI IDE integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v3-mcp-support/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python setup_mcp.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Environment Variables Configuration for Archon
DESCRIPTION: Example of the required environment variables that need to be set in the .env file, including API keys for OpenAI and Supabase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v1-single-agent/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: env
CODE:
```
OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_api_key
SUPABASE_URL=your_supabase_url
SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY=your_supabase_service_key
LLM_MODEL=gpt-4o-mini  # or your preferred OpenAI model
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Environment Variables Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Example environment variables configuration that needs to be set in a .env file. Includes API keys, base URLs, and model preferences for LLMs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v2-agentic-workflow/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: env
CODE:
```
BASE_URL=https://api.openai.com/v1 for OpenAI, https://api.openrouter.ai/v1 for OpenRouter, or your Ollama URL
LLM_API_KEY=your_openai_or_openrouter_api_key
OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_api_key
SUPABASE_URL=your_supabase_url
SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY=your_supabase_service_key
PRIMARY_MODEL=gpt-4o-mini  # or your preferred OpenAI model for main agent
REASONER_MODEL=o3-mini     # or your preferred OpenAI model for reasoning
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables
DESCRIPTION: Example environment configuration file showing required API keys and preferences for connecting to OpenAI/OpenRouter, Supabase, and selecting LLM models.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v3-mcp-support/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: env
CODE:
```
BASE_URL=https://api.openai.com/v1 for OpenAI, https://api.openrouter.ai/v1 for OpenRouter, or your Ollama URL
LLM_API_KEY=your_openai_or_openrouter_api_key
OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_api_key
SUPABASE_URL=your_supabase_url
SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY=your_supabase_service_key
PRIMARY_MODEL=your_main_coding_llm
REASONER_MODEL=your_reasoning_llm
EMBEDDING_MODEL=your_embedding_model
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Streamlit UI
DESCRIPTION: Command to launch the Streamlit user interface for Archon after setting up the local Python environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
streamlit run streamlit_ui.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Streamlit UI (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Streamlit user interface for Archon. This is used after setting up the local Python environment to launch the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v5-parallel-specialized-agents/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
streamlit run streamlit_ui.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Streamlit Web Interface
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Streamlit web interface for interacting with the Archon agent, which will be available at http://localhost:8501.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v1-single-agent/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
streamlit run streamlit_ui.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Launching the Streamlit Web Interface
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Streamlit web interface that provides an interactive way to query the documentation and create Pydantic AI agents.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v2-agentic-workflow/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
streamlit run streamlit_ui.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Graph Service for MCP Integration
DESCRIPTION: Command for starting the FastAPI graph service that handles the agentic workflow and supports MCP integration with AI IDEs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v3-mcp-support/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python graph_service.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Launching the Streamlit UI
DESCRIPTION: Command for starting the Streamlit web interface that provides an interactive way to interact with the Archon system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v3-mcp-support/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
streamlit run streamlit_ui.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Archon with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Commands to update Archon to the latest version when using Docker, including pulling the latest changes and rebuilding containers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Pull the latest changes from the repository (from within the archon directory)
git pull

# Rebuild and restart the containers with the latest changes
python run_docker.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Archon with Local Python Installation
DESCRIPTION: Commands to update Archon to the latest version when using a local Python installation, including pulling changes and updating dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Pull the latest changes from the repository (from within the archon directory)
git pull

# Install any new dependencies
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Restart the Streamlit UI
# (If you're already running it, stop with Ctrl+C first)
streamlit run streamlit_ui.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Documentation Crawler in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the script that crawls Pydantic AI documentation, generates embeddings, and stores them in Supabase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v1-single-agent/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python crawl_pydantic_ai_docs.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Crawling Pydantic AI Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the documentation crawler script which fetches, processes, and stores Pydantic AI documentation in a vector database.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v2-agentic-workflow/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python crawl_pydantic_ai_docs.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Crawling and Storing Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Command for running the documentation crawler that fetches URLs from the sitemap, crawls each page, splits content into chunks, generates embeddings, and stores them in the Supabase database.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v3-mcp-support/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python archon/crawl_pydantic_ai_docs.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Activating Virtual Environment for Crawler and Graph Service
DESCRIPTION: Command for activating the virtual environment to run the documentation crawler and graph service after MCP setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v3-mcp-support/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Supabase Database Schema for Site Pages in SQL
DESCRIPTION: SQL schema definition for the Supabase database used by Archon. This creates a site_pages table with columns for content storage and vector embeddings for AI retrieval operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE TABLE site_pages (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
    url TEXT,
    chunk_number INTEGER,
    title TEXT,
    summary TEXT,
    content TEXT,
    metadata JSONB,
    embedding VECTOR(1536) -- Adjust dimensions as necessary (i.e. 768 for nomic-embed-text)
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Supabase Database Schema for Site Pages
DESCRIPTION: SQL schema for the site_pages table in Supabase that stores documentation chunks, their metadata, and vector embeddings for similarity search.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v1-single-agent/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE TABLE site_pages (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
    url TEXT,
    chunk_number INTEGER,
    title TEXT,
    summary TEXT,
    content TEXT,
    metadata JSONB,
    embedding VECTOR(1536)
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Supabase Database Schema Definition
DESCRIPTION: SQL commands defining the site_pages table schema used to store documentation chunks with their embeddings and metadata in Supabase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v2-agentic-workflow/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE TABLE site_pages (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
    url TEXT,
    chunk_number INTEGER,
    title TEXT,
    summary TEXT,
    content TEXT,
    metadata JSONB,
    embedding VECTOR(1536)
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Supabase Database Schema for Document Storage
DESCRIPTION: SQL schema for the site_pages table that stores document chunks, embeddings, and metadata. Used to create the table structure in Supabase for vector similarity search.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v3-mcp-support/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE TABLE site_pages (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
    url TEXT,
    chunk_number INTEGER,
    title TEXT,
    summary TEXT,
    content TEXT,
    metadata JSONB,
    embedding VECTOR(1536) -- Adjust dimensions as necessary (i.e. 768 for nomic-embed-text)
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Document Chunking Size
DESCRIPTION: Python configuration for setting the character size of documentation chunks. Located in the crawl_pydantic_ai_docs.py file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v2-agentic-workflow/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
chunk_size = 5000  # Characters per chunk
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Chunking Parameters in Python
DESCRIPTION: Python code snippet showing how to configure the chunking parameters in the crawl_pydantic_ai_docs.py script, which determines how documentation is split into chunks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v1-single-agent/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
chunk_size = 5000  # Characters per chunk
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Requirements.txt Dependencies List
DESCRIPTION: Complete list of Python package dependencies with pinned version numbers. Includes packages for web frameworks (FastAPI), AI/ML libraries (langchain, openai), data processing tools (pandas, numpy), and various utility packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/Archon/blob/main/iterations/v4-streamlit-ui-overhaul/requirements.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
